rev.comment: added info about estimate of 12 million users
rev.diff:
Line 221: Line 221:
Ubuntu was awarded the Reader Award for best Linux distribution at the 2005 [[LinuxWorld Conference and Expo]] in London,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://w3.linux-magazine.com/issue/61/Linuxworld_London_UK_2005.pdf |title=LinuxWorld Expo UK 2005 |format=PDF |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> has been favorably reviewed in online and print publications,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.reviewlinux.com/index.php/?m=show&id=39 |title=Ubuntu - A New Approach to Desktop Linux |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/8253 |title=Linux in Government: Linux Desktop Reviews, Part 6 - Ubuntu |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |last=McAllister |first=Neil |publication-date=January 2008 |title=Gutsy Gibbon: Desktop Linux OS Made Easy |periodical=PC World |volume=26 |issue=1 |page=84 |url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/138884/first_look_ubuntu_710_desktop_linux.html |accessdate=2008-08-19}}.</ref> and has won [[InfoWorld]]'s 2007 Bossie Award for ''Best Open Source Client OS''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.infoworld.com/t/platforms/best-open-source-in-platforms-and-middleware-129 |title=Best of open source in platforms and middleware |accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref>
Ubuntu was awarded the Reader Award for best Linux distribution at the 2005 [[LinuxWorld Conference and Expo]] in London,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://w3.linux-magazine.com/issue/61/Linuxworld_London_UK_2005.pdf |title=LinuxWorld Expo UK 2005 |format=PDF |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref> has been favorably reviewed in online and print publications,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.reviewlinux.com/index.php/?m=show&id=39 |title=Ubuntu - A New Approach to Desktop Linux |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.linuxjournal.com/article/8253 |title=Linux in Government: Linux Desktop Reviews, Part 6 - Ubuntu |accessdate=2008-08-19}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |last=McAllister |first=Neil |publication-date=January 2008 |title=Gutsy Gibbon: Desktop Linux OS Made Easy |periodical=PC World |volume=26 |issue=1 |page=84 |url=http://www.pcworld.com/article/138884/first_look_ubuntu_710_desktop_linux.html |accessdate=2008-08-19}}.</ref> and has won [[InfoWorld]]'s 2007 Bossie Award for ''Best Open Source Client OS''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.infoworld.com/t/platforms/best-open-source-in-platforms-and-middleware-129 |title=Best of open source in platforms and middleware |accessdate=2008-06-13}}</ref>
  +
In April 2010, Chris Kenyon, vice president for OEM at [[Canonical Ltd.]] estimated that there were 12 million Ubuntu users.<ref name="Kerner07Apr10"> {{cite web|url = http://www.linuxplanet.com/linuxplanet/reports/7032/1/|title = Ubuntu Claims 12 Million Users as Lucid Linux Desktop Nears|accessdate = 07 April 2010|last = Kerner|first = Michael|authorlink = |year = 2010|month = April}}</ref>
[[Jamie Hyneman]], co-host of the television series ''[[Mythbusters]]'', has advocated Linux, specifically giving the example of Ubuntu, as an alternative to proprietary software, citing [[software bloat]] as a major hurdle in proprietary operating systems.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wayofthegeek.org/2008/01/mythbuster-advocates-linux/ |title=MythBuster Advocates Linux |accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/upgrade/4243994.html?page=3 |title=MythBusters: 7 Tech Headachesâand How to Fix Them |accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref>
[[Jamie Hyneman]], co-host of the television series ''[[Mythbusters]]'', has advocated Linux, specifically giving the example of Ubuntu, as an alternative to proprietary software, citing [[software bloat]] as a major hurdle in proprietary operating systems.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wayofthegeek.org/2008/01/mythbuster-advocates-linux/ |title=MythBuster Advocates Linux |accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/upgrade/4243994.html?page=3 |title=MythBusters: 7 Tech Headachesâand How to Fix Them |accessdate=2009-01-27}}</ref>
